content: The policy of the United States is to end animal suffering caused by steel-jawed leghold traps by prohibiting their import, export, and interstate shipment, along with fur from animals trapped in such traps. Additionally, selling or acquiring traps in violation of these rules is prohibited. It is illegal to import, export, or transport steel-jawed leghold traps across state lines. Selling or acquiring traps in violation of these rules is prohibited, with penalties including imprisonment or fines. Penalties for violating the prohibition on importing, exporting, or transporting steel-jawed leghold traps across state lines include imprisonment for up to 5 days or fines under title 18, United States Code, for the first offense, and imprisonment for up to 2 years for subsequent violations.
